title: History of present illness
content: Patient reports finger pain. No avoidance of activities reported by mother. Nail shows ingrowth approximately 70% of the way with excellent consensuses to proximal 30%. Full active motion is present without limitation. No worsening or improvement noted. No prior treatments or remedies reported.
instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity or intensity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since their onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy.

Additionally, specify whether the patient has been recently diagnosed with any major conditions such as cancer, has undergone a kidney transplant, or is currently undergoing major surgery, chemotherapy, or cardiac clearance. These conditions are critical, as they may impact treatment plans, including adjustments to cardiac medications.

Describe how these symptoms affect the patient's daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any relevant interactions or conversations related to the illness.

title: Current Medications
instruction:
Document the patient's current medications in the following format: Begin with the full generic name of each medication, followed by the brand name in parentheses if applicable (e.g., "Aspirin (Bayer)"). Specify the dosage strength (e.g., "81 mg") and indicate the frequency of administration (e.g., "Once daily"). Describe the route of administration, such as oral, topical, or by injection (e.g., "Oral Aspirin"). Lastly, for ongoing medications, note the duration for which the patient has been taking each medication (e.g., "on Aspirin for 3 weeks"). If no current medications are reported, document "No current medications found."

sub-section.title: Orthopnea (shortness of breath while lying down)
sub-section.instruction: Extract any mentions of the patient having difficulty breathing while lying down. Capture how many pillows the patient uses to sleep or any positional adjustments they make to relieve symptoms.

sub-section.title: Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea
sub-section.instruction: Identify instances where the patient describes waking up suddenly at night due to shortness of breath. Include details about how frequently this occurs and any associated symptoms.

sub-section.title: Edema (swelling, especially in the legs)
sub-section.instruction: Extract details about any swelling the patient reports, particularly in the legs or ankles. Note the severity, whether the swelling is persistent or intermittent, and any associated discomfort.

sub-section.title: Syncope (fainting)
sub-section.instruction: Extract any mention of the patient experiencing fainting spells. Include details about the frequency, circumstances surrounding the episodes, and whether the patient experiences any warning signs before fainting.

sub-section.title: Heart sounds (murmurs, gallops)
sub-section.instruction: Extract the doctor’s observations regarding the patient's heart sounds, specifically noting any murmurs or gallops. Include details about the characteristics of the sounds, such as their location and timing.

sub-section.title: Jugular venous distention
sub-section.instruction: Extract the physician's findings on jugular venous distention. Capture any descriptions of the patient's jugular vein appearance or measurements related to distention.

sub-section.title: Peripheral pulses
sub-section.instruction: Identify any assessment of the patient's peripheral pulses. Capture details about pulse strength, symmetry between limbs, and any abnormalities noted by the doctor.

sub-section.title: Blood pressure
sub-section.instruction: Extract the patient's blood pressure readings as reported during the examination. Include any discussion about changes or concerns related to these readings.

sub-section.title: Edema assessment
sub-section.instruction: Identify any assessment of edema conducted during the physical examination. Capture details such as the location, severity, and whether the edema is pitting or non-pitting.

sub-section.title: Lung auscultation for rales
sub-section.instruction: Extract information related to the doctor’s lung auscultation findings, particularly focusing on the presence of rales. Include details about the location and characteristics of the rales.
